sailpoint.object
Class AttributeDefinition

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      sailpoint.object.BaseAttributeDefinition
          sailpoint.object.AttributeDefinition
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject
public class AttributeDefinition
extends BaseAttributeDefinition

The definition of an application schema attribute.

See Also:

Method Detail

tokenizeSource

public static java.lang.String[] tokenizeSource(java.lang.String source)
source is expected to be 'application.attribute' with application and attribute having any periods escaped.

isEntitlement

public boolean isEntitlement()
A flag to indicate if an attribute is an entitlement. This is used to determine which attributes should be treated as additional entitlements during entitlement correlation, and should be included when prototype objects are created.

setEntitlement

public void setEntitlement(boolean entitlement)
Sets the is entitlement flag.

isGroup

@Deprecated
public boolean isGroup()
Deprecated. use Schema.getGroupAttribute()

Returns a boolean indicating that the attribute represents group membership. The values of the attribute will be used to create a set of ManagedAttribute objects during aggregation.

setGroup

@Deprecated
public void setGroup(boolean b)
Deprecated. use Schema.setGroupAttribute(String)

Sets the group flag.

isManaged

public boolean isManaged()
Returns a boolean indicating that the attribute is managed.

setManaged

public void setManaged(boolean b)
Sets the managed flag.

getCorrelationKey

public int getCorrelationKey()
The correlation key number assigned to this attribute. This must be a positive integer from 1 to 4 (the maximum may be raised if necessary).

When this is set, it indicates that the value of the attribute must be stored in a way that facilitates fast searching. The number must be unique among the attributes in a given Schema.

setCorrelationKey

public void setCorrelationKey(int i)

isCorrelationKeyAssigned

public boolean isCorrelationKeyAssigned()
Transient flag to indicate whether this attribute is supposed to have a correlation key assignment. This is is used only during editing of the attribute in the UI.

setCorrelationKeyAssigned

public void setCorrelationKeyAssigned(boolean b)

isMinable

public boolean isMinable()
A flag to indicate if an attribute is to be considered during entitlement mining.

setMinable

public void setMinable(boolean _minable)

getSource

public java.lang.String getSource()
Additional source metadata concerning the attribute. Currently this is only being used for attributes on composite applications.

setSource

public void setSource(java.lang.String source)
With regard to defining the source, do not use this method for defining the composite source definition. Use AttributeDefinition.setCompositeSource(String, String) instead. This method will make any attempt to escape tokens in the intended source value.

setCompositeSource

public void setCompositeSource(java.lang.String application,
                               java.lang.String attribute)
Sets the source application and attribute for this attribute. This only applies to composite applications.

Parameters:
application - Application name
attribute - Attribute name

getCompositeSourceApplication

public java.lang.String getCompositeSourceApplication()
Convenience method to retrieve the application this attribute is sourced from. This only applies to composite applications.

Returns:
Source app or null.

getCompositeSourceAttribute

public java.lang.String getCompositeSourceAttribute()
Convenience method to retrieve the attribute on an another application that this attribute is sourced from. This only applies to composite applications.

Returns:
Source app or null.

getRemediationModificationType

public AttributeDefinition.UserInterfaceInputType getRemediationModificationType()
An enumeration value specifying how remediations of values for this attribute can occur. If null, this attribute cannot be modified in a remediation request.

setRemediationModificationType

public void setRemediationModificationType(AttributeDefinition.UserInterfaceInputType type)

isRemediationModifiable

public boolean isRemediationModifiable()
Return whether this attribute can be modified in a remediation request.

getInternalName

public java.lang.String getInternalName()
Return the internal name for this attribute used within the connector.

setInternalName

public void setInternalName(java.lang.String s)

getInternalOrName

public java.lang.String getInternalOrName()
Return the internal name of an attribute if non-null, otherwise return the name.

Returns:
The internal name or name of this attribute.

isEditable

public boolean isEditable()
Always returns true; included only for compatibility with the ObjectAttribute class

Returns:
true

getSchemaObjectType

public java.lang.String getSchemaObjectType()

setSchemaObjectType

isGroupAttribute

public boolean isGroupAttribute()
Logic to deteremine if this AttributeDefinition represents a group attribute. We currently base this off of the presense of a schemaObjectType

Returns:
true if this AttributeDefinition corresponds to a group attribute
